radio_info.short: Power 91 is Southern Utah University’s student radio station — a popular source for alternative rock, local news, sports and other student-produced programming. The station
radio_info.rest:
broadcasts at KSUU 91.1 FM in the Cedar City area and online.

Popular programs include the station’s Morning Brew (weekdays from 8 to 10 a.m.) and an assortment of award-winning sports programming.

Power 91 is also the flagship station for Southern Utah Athletics and broadcasts all Football and Basketball games.

Students in Comm 1560 and Comm 3503 produce most of the programming on Power 91 and act as many of the stations DJs.

Power 91 sponsors popular campus activities, including Guitars Unplugged, a competition for acoustic guitarists that helps support a student food bank.

radio_info.short: Broadcasting from Live365.com, Midnight Special Blues Radio was founded on January 16, 2004 as a non-commercial project with the goal of promoting the music of
radio_info.rest:
independent blues and blues rock artists all around the world. 
  
  More specifically, our goal is to show that there are more stars in the sky than a handful of constellations and to present to the world those who have paved and go on paving the way of the blues - the unknown Masters. 
  
  With all respect to the roots, it's the tree above, the branches and leaves that we will pay more attention to. Blues is not an old dying man whom we love and "keep alive" almost against his will. The age of the blues is defined by the age of the artists that play it and of their listeners. Seen this way, blues is in his middle forties, full of creative imagination and living energy. The best way to keep him "alive" is to let him live as he himself feels he should. 
  
  Johnny Carson once called Sammy Davis, Jr. "the greatest entertainer this world has ever seen." Sammy's answer was, "Hey, there's some guy working in a garage somewhere who's got us all beat!"

Broadcasting for 25 years, KCPW is a trusted source of in-depth news and information for Salt Lake metropolitan area listeners.


OUR MISSION:

* Create informed and engaged citizens by providing in-depth local, national and international news
* Connect and involve our audience by presenting news, lectures, local events and special broadcasts related to politics, the environment, education and business
* Foster and strengthen our community by partnering with local business and organizations
* Act as a lifelong resource, so that we may all grow and improve public discourse

radio_info.rest:
on providing our volunteer broadcasters a valuable and fun broadcasting experience within an academic setting. We hope that the listener finds what we have to offer entertaining, educational and useful. K-UTE broadcasts online at http://www.kuteradio.com, over University of Utah TV on channel 99, and on 1620 AM around the campus.

K-UTE also provides the University of Utah and greater Salt Lake communities with an effective medium for promoting their events and causes. To utilize these services, please follow this link. We're here to give the students a place to be heard and hear what they want.

Call us anytime in the studio at 801-585-3449. Or drop by, 4th floor of the Union on the U of U campus. Contact live DJs via mail at: kutedj@gmail.com

radio_info.short: Utah Free Media (UtahFM) is a forum for the people, music and ideas that populate Utah. In addition to the live-stream and archives we offer,
radio_info.rest:
UtahFM’s core quality of community means that we can extend ourselves in ways traditionally thought outside the realm of public radio – unique and captivating partnerships with neighboring organizations that deliver on similar aims as ours – great culture, unique and engaging experiences. From our downtown, Salt Lake City studio, Utah Free Media can grow to become a major community force – the truly community radio force of Salt Lake City that is liberated from entanglements of various natures that notoriously encumber other radio endeavors.

We’ve been independent since we got into radio 30 years ago. Independence means freedom to make unique and new cultural associations, break and redefine the possibilities of genre and medium, deliver content that is free from auxiliary or secondary pressures or considerations, and to really focus on what matters most to us:  great programming, innovative DJs, authentic community connections, and the opportunity to connect folks who may ordinarily be inside their own post-modern bubbles and form a community made up of true individuals. Folks who make up their own mind, follow their own bliss and choose to pursue their own interests in life rather than the hashed-out, cliche and boring. We are independent because we choose to be, and we intend to capitalize on every bit of that unique opportunity. 

Utah Free Media (UtahFM) is a station unabashedly driven by amateur radio enthusiasts. While we run our station professionally and take our commitment to quality seriously, we are, ultimately, just plain enthusiasts of great public radio. We create programming out of the matter that tickles our souls, and will in turn, tickle those of others. Our collective interests, passions, connections, knowledge, experience and drive will make this station a unique and invaluable source for authentic community programming. We offer audiences a live-feed by which they can hear everything we’ve got to offer – a voyage through the eclectic annals of Salt Lake music and adventurous radio programming.  The enthusiastic listener thus connects, quickly and powerfully, with the programmer.
